list.name: Default
list.comment:
Add first prototype of Beeswarm/Violin Plots
So far it's just a demonstration that it can be done. Data displayed is randomly generated.
Next step is to actually grab data from SOLR

list.name: VB-3798 Create Violin/Beeswarm Box Plot for selected IR markers
VB-3800 SOLR 5.2 not working with marcro expansion when used within solrconfig.xml
list.comment:
VB-3800 SOLR 5.2 not working with marcro expansion when used within solrconfig.xml
Tried to solve the issue by upgrading vb_popbio schema files to the 5.2 format. The issue still remains but I will keep the upgraded solr schema files. I also made some minor changes to the JS code to align with the new schema

task.summary: Default task
*Minor changes to make the code live on funcgen
* Replaced internal SOLR URLs with proxied ones
* Fixed VB CSS link
* Moved search box at the top center of the map
* Added Result counts in all categories. A user can now click in one of these listings to search directly within a category of even everywhere * Various bugfixes
* User can now freely input a universal search term by pressing Enter * Duplicated search terms detection now also takes into account the field/class of the term * Various bugfixes
* Added a reset button for search * Beautified the search field
* Added a search the world toggle button * Improved SOLR query and BBox generation

* Added font awesome icons to search terms: ** Taxonomy gets fa-sitemap ** Title gets fa-tag ** Description gets fa-info-circle ** Projects get fa-database ** Anywhere gets fa-search * Simplified color scheme for search terms: ** Taxonomy gets blue (label-primary) ** Other tags get green (label-success) ** Free search gets grey (label-default)
* Re-engineered SOLR query construction to give to rely more on fq (instead q) and thus give a slight perfornance gain due to caching * Samples counter now says 'X samples in current view'
* Merge (hopefully correct this time)

* Added colored markers for single-species samples * Fine-tuned pie-charts ** They no longer draw gaps between pie segments ** More than 8 species/colored showed * Discovered a bug in SOLR data with samples missing the species_category field * Updated prunecluster & leaflet-dvf libs to the latest version * Added Leaflet.vector-markers lib to the project
* Removed shadows from single-specimen markers * Fixed an issue in leaflet.vector-markers lib that caused inner icons to not display properly on firefox
* Moved the legend to the bottom-right of the map so as to not interfere with the charts on the left side ** Made it toggleable
* Pushed minified version of easy-button
* Cleaned the generated query for fetching small clusters * Added an error check to skip processing geohashes with every sample missing the species_category field
* Code cleanup

* Redone the query generation ** Terms from the same category are grouped together with an OR clause ** Terms from different categories are added with an AND clause ** For example, this allows to search for samples of one (or more) species that were collected in one (or more) areas
* Restructured directories * Added SOLR configs to repo

* Added search handlers separately for samples and IR assays with most options predefined. This decreased significantly the length of the SOLR GET requests * Fixed type boosting in auto-complete. * Fixed partial search initiated with the @ symbol
* Fixed partial searches field mapping, initiated with the auto-complete

* If a field has an accompanying _cvterms field then search will be done using the _cvterms field ** This is because in many cases, upper level terms (e.g. Brazil for Geography) may actually be the in the lowest level field (geolocations) instead in the _cvterms ** Only exception for now is species, since it seems to be more accurately defined * Fixed a couple of bugs in type to field mapping

* Replace "More results" with "More suggestions" at auto-complete * More suggestions counts have a "~" indicator now ** This is until I solve why for some types suggestion and result counts don't match
* Added "Insecticide Resistance Phenotypes" view ** Fine tuned behavior when switching views ** Added auto-update for the legend as well
* Fixed typo for Palette (was Pallete) throughout the project
* Type-ahead query URLs are now set properly when changing views
* Updated SOLR configs to 5.x * smplGeoclust now returns only min, max, count and mean statistics. This should speed up geoclusters calculations
* Trying a new setup ** All markers now are computed on SOLR unless *** It is a single-sample marker *** All samples in the marker are from the exact same location
* Finetuned markers clustering * Added support for synonyms in auto-complete
* Code cleanup and re-arrangement
* Refined the starting location of the map * Added vb-violin-plots.(js|css). Still no working violin plots though * Re-built minified versions of most js and css files
* Switched to a new project structure ** Libs are now repos
* Replaced all local libs with the repo equivalents * Re-structured the project
* Added minified versions for all css and js files in all repos
* Added minified versions for all css and js files in all repos
* Fixed include paths for libs
* Moved all libs under /web * Removed unnecessary files (docs, examples, etc) from libs repos
* Moved all libs under /web * Removed unnecessary files (docs, examples, etc) from libs repos
* Fixed a bug in palette generation that caused a crash when the number of items in the palette was lower than the number of requested colors

Apply camelCase to method names
Rename initialize_search and initialize map to initializeSeach and initializeMap respectively

Fix Beeswarm to properly return the swarm
Beeswarm only returned the original data. Did some minor code restru- cturing to also return the swarm data.
Update D3 to 3.5.5

Add first prototype of Beeswarm/Violin Plots
So far it's just a demonstration that it can be done. Data displayed is randomly generated.
Next step is to actually grab data from SOLR
Create Violin/Beeswarm Box Plot for selected IR markers

changelist.name: VB-3798 Create Violin/Beeswarm Box Plot for selected IR markers

task.summary: SOLR 5.2 not working with marcro expansion when used within solrconfig.xml

changelist.name: VB-3800 SOLR 5.2 not working with marcro expansion when used within solrconfig.xml

task.summary: Add SOLR search handler for IR marker statistics
Adds first prototype of SOLR driven beeswarm plots
Return domain (lowest to highest values) of the X axis

Add features and fix bugs of beeswarm plots
beeswarm function is now called using a scaled radius value. This results with x and y values being in a comparable domain and fixes issues presented when the y values where smaller than 1
Adds boxplots to the beeswarm plots
Beeswarm plots are now fitted (using internal D3 scale mechanism) the plot of the width. This means that markers with a lot of identical phenotype value will results in points being very close to each other. On the same hand, if a marker has very few phenotypes the points may be too far apart. Overall though it works better than before and this is the version I'm sticking for now.
Added promises to the AJAX calls for the beeswarm plots. Should result in more reliable operation
Return domain (lowest to highest values) of the X axis

option.name: searchQuery
option.value: assignee = currentUser() and resolution = Unresolved order by updated

MESSAGE.value: * Replace "More results" with "More suggestions" at auto-complete * More suggestions counts have a "~" indicator now ** This is until I solve why for some types suggestion and result counts don't match
* Added "Insecticide Resistance Phenotypes" view ** Fine tuned behavior when switching views ** Added auto-update for the legend as well
* Fixed typo for Palette (was Pallete) throughout the project
* Type-ahead query URLs are now set properly when changing views
* Updated SOLR configs to 5.x * smplGeoclust now returns only min, max, count and mean statistics. This should speed up geoclusters calculations
* Trying a new setup ** All markers now are computed on SOLR unless *** It is a single-sample marker *** All samples in the marker are from the exact same location
* Finetuned markers clustering * Added support for synonyms in auto-complete
* Code cleanup and re-arrangement
* Refined the starting location of the map * Added vb-violin-plots.(js|css). Still no working violin plots though * Re-built minified versions of most js and css files
* Switched to a new project structure ** Libs are now repos
* Replaced all local libs with the repo equivalents * Re-structured the project
* Added minified versions for all css and js files in all repos
* Fixed include paths for libs
* Moved all libs under /web * Removed unnecessary files (docs, examples, etc) from libs repos
* Fixed a bug in palette generation that caused a crash when the number of items in the palette was lower than the number of requested colors

Apply camelCase to method names
Rename initialize_search and initialize map to initializeSeach and initializeMap respectively

Fix Beeswarm to properly return the swarm
Beeswarm only returned the original data. Did some minor code restru- cturing to also return the swarm data.
Update D3 to 3.5.5

Add first prototype of Beeswarm/Violin Plots
So far it's just a demonstration that it can be done. Data displayed is randomly generated.
Next step is to actually grab data from SOLR

VB-3800 SOLR 5.2 not working with marcro expansion when used within solrconfig.xml
Tried to solve the issue by upgrading vb_popbio schema files to the 5.2 format. The issue still remains but I will keep the upgraded solr schema files. I also made some minor changes to the JS code to align with the new schema
Add SOLR search handler for IR marker statistics
Adds first prototype of SOLR driven beeswarm plots
Return domain (lowest to highest values) of the X axis

Add features and fix bugs of beeswarm plots
beeswarm function is now called using a scaled radius value. This results with x and y values being in a comparable domain and fixes issues presented when the y values where smaller than 1
Adds boxplots to the beeswarm plots
Beeswarm plots are now fitted (using internal D3 scale mechanism) the plot of the width. This means that markers with a lot of identical phenotype value will results in points being very close to each other. On the same hand, if a marker has very few phenotypes the points may be too far apart. Overall though it works better than before and this is the version I'm sticking for now.
Added promises to the AJAX calls for the beeswarm plots. Should result in more reliable operation

This means that markers with a lot of identical phenotype value will results in points being very close to each other. On the same hand, if a marker has very few phenotypes the points may be too far apart. Overall though it works better than before and this is the version I'm sticking for now.

Add features and fix bugs of beeswarm plots
beeswarm function is now called using a scaled radius value. This results with x and y values being in a comparable domain and fixes issues presented when the y values where smaller than 1
Adds boxplots to the beeswarm plots
Beeswarm plots are now fitted (using internal D3 scale mechanism) the plot of the width. This means that markers with a lot of identical phenotype value will results in points being very close to each other. On the same hand, if a marker has very few phenotypes the points may be too far apart. Overall though it works better than before and this is the version I'm sticking for now.
